newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Kia Motors Jan car sales hit by strikes.
newsitem.headline: Kia Motors Jan car sales hit by strikes.

text.p: Kia Motors Corp, one of South Korea's leading carmakers, said on Tuesday its sales dropped to to 26,459 units in January from 63,165 a year ago.
A company spokesman said strikes in the month were mainly to blame for the fall.
The spokesman said exports in the month totalled 11,654 units, down from 20,135 units a year ago.
Strikes, which erupted in protest at the forced passage of a new labour law on December 26, cost the company 35,400 units in lost production. The Kia strikes ended in mid-January.
The law allows employers to sack workers amd replace strikers.
Kia said it aimed to sell 950,000 vehicles in 1997, 410,000 of them for export. In 1996, Kia sold a total of 781,250 units, including exports totalling 322,850.
